info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 30 at 5:17PM MDT until June 30 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN OTERO...SOUTHEASTERN CROWLEY AND NORTHWESTERN BENT COUNTIES... At 515 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Cheraw, or 8 miles north of North La Junta, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...La Junta automated weather sensor measured a 62 mph wind gust at 512 PM. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... La Junta, North La Junta, Swink, Cheraw and Blue Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with this storm will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
